critique: The document is a revocation of a previous executive order and an opening of public lands to ex-service men and the general public. The tone is formal and legalistic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is joy for the ex-service men who are given priority for homesteading and desert land laws. There might be some surprise for the general public when the land becomes available to them. There is no indication of sadness, anger, fear, or disgust.
